website_summaries.verdict: Bare bones, simple way to strip corn in large or small quantities.
pros: Who needs a fancy design when this simple object works just as well?
Just stand corn on a cutting board, place ring around it, and push down
Ring adjusts to size of corn
cons: Like all corn peelers, kernels may fly every which way

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the time it takes to complete the order!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I grow my own corn every year. It's a pain cutting it off the cob with a knife. This thing is a huge disappointment. Mind you it "(kind of works)" but it does not get everything the first swipe as it should. You'd be better off finding an antique one which actually work than buying this piece of junk. The cutters are extremely flimsy & will NOT conture to the shape of different sized ears. It's just a piece of junk at best. Find a different one instead of wasting your money on this thing.
customer_reviews.author: psychoccu1

customer_reviews.title: Making twice the amount of fresh corn recipes
customer_reviews.text: I like to make corn salsa but I very much dislike cutting the kernels of the cob. This little tool makes it much easier. I took off one star because it takes awhile to get used to placement on the cob and because every cob is different, the chances of not getting the entire kernal is pretty high. I do like this and I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Tracie R.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: The Quick Corn Cutter Stripper is the best corn stripper tool we have used! It is effective and efficient. It facilitates a more complete removal of corn kernels than other tools we have used. We place the corn cob upright on a bunt pan and use the Quick Corn Cutter Stripper to strip the kernels into the pan. The flexible nature of the tool enables us to strip kernels from different diameters of cobs; an excellent feature! This is a must buy!
customer_reviews.author: Mark C

customer_reviews.title: This has been the best tool ever
customer_reviews.text: I just cut 40+ dozen ears of corn off the cob to freeze. I've tried electric knives, special corn cutting tools, knives... etc. This has been the best tool ever. After getting a feel for how much pressure to put on the open end Its a breeze to go through a dozen ears in like a minute or less. Take it for me. This tool is sooo worth the money in time savings. I'm buying 2 more so I can have spare and a little help next time.
customer_reviews.author: roll cyclones

customer_reviews.title: "Okay"
customer_reviews.text: Not my favorite, but used it for the last several years before finding a new kind. I usually buy a few at a time (if you are putting up corn for the year) because they do tend to break. Definitely better than nothing. ;)
customer_reviews.author: harpster4

customer_reviews.title: Soso corn cutter
customer_reviews.text: This is okay but the other one we bought that has a black handle and cutter blades work real well.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Roeske

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: This product absolutely did not work for us. A total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Made my job easier !
customer_reviews.text: Made the tedious job of cutting corn off the cob super easy with the drill screw (purchased separately from another seller). Without drill attachment this tool is hard to use.
customer_reviews.author: loras

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, but not the easiest tool to use.
customer_reviews.author: Erin R Houser

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Just JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two of these to do 360 ears of corn. Both were broken on the first 5 ears of corn. The handle and stainless blades work as intended. The problem is the blades are held on with SOFT aluminum rivets. The rivets sheared off and the tool was useless at that point. Junk as built. Don't waste your money on these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke on the first ear of corn!
customer_reviews.text: It broke the very first ear of corn I tried. Bought a similar product by a different brand....still working as great as it did the first time 5 dozen ears later! The concept of this product is great but not the quality. Search for a different brand!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: cutter rivets got loose pretty quick. be aware that this will happen and ...
customer_reviews.text: cutter rivets got loose pretty quick. be aware that this will happen and try your best to hold closer to the cob to give it more sturdiness. makes things go faster just wish it was made stronger. I may try the little screws like another person suggested on here.
customer_reviews.author: Rick cessna

customer_reviews.title: Blown Away with Time Savings
customer_reviews.text: I had always hand-cut corn off of the cob with a knife. Used the Kernerl Kutter for the first time this season and was blow away with the time that we saved. We normally put up about 150 ears of corn. By using this new device, we cut our time in half.
customer_reviews.author: Murc

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these pieces. They both broke within 10 minutes of use My son had one of something similar, and his worked perfect, but it is a different brand and made much heavier. The blades on the ones I ordered are in 2 pieces and they twist and break at the point of pivot. Would not recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Zeen

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome! I used it to strip some corn for freezing---it is really easy to use and seems sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Went back to knife
customer_reviews.text: If corn was a little fat you couldn't use the cutter. I had to push like hell to get it to slice thru the corn. Found it easier to going back to use a knife.
customer_reviews.author: terry

customer_reviews.title: not substantial
customer_reviews.text: it broke on the second ear of corn the metal came apart
customer_reviews.author: darlene

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money. I have tried it on both cooked and uncooked corn. It does not cut the corn off the cob. I will be sticking with the tried and true version of using a chef knife.
customer_reviews.author: bearvegas

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Time
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your time. I bought 4 of these to aid in stripping corn for canning. 1 broke 3 ears in and 2 more broke not long after. Just suck it up and use a bundt pan and knife.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived within the expected time frame and was as described in listing.
customer_reviews.author: patty zerrusen

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time and money
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this. I think it is supposed to be used on cooked corn maybe. Otherwise, it is not very useful. We ended cutting corn off cob with a knife.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on the first ear of corn....BUT...
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this corn stripper, but it broke on the second ear of corn.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Broke already.
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for a easy way to cut corn off of the cob, this didn’t work through 3 dozen of corn. The metal cutting part actually broke in half. It was nice while it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Miller

customer_reviews.title: Just what the wife needed
customer_reviews.text: Wife loved this item. Cuts corn from cob in very short time with little effort.
customer_reviews.author: William Cashion

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Makes putting up corn go a lot faster.
customer_reviews.author: susan parish

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This worked fantastic! Love how well it takes the kernels off the cob. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Device broke on first use
customer_reviews.text: Product broke on the first ear of corn I tried to use it on. Cutting blade came off. No instructions on how to use.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F.

customer_reviews.title: Junk- Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Used this stripper on less than 10 ears of corn and the rivets that hold the blade in place ripped out. Should have zero stars.
customer_reviews.author: The Bick

customer_reviews.title: Worst Ever and dangerous !!!!
customer_reviews.text: New from the package it could not even cut the kernels of 1 cob of sweet corn. Tried on 2 and it bent in the second making it quire dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 cobs
customer_reviews.text: Brand new out of the box, I attempted to strip corn cobs. It broke after 3 cobs and left metal pieces in the corn. Cheaply built, would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: John Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Its junk
customer_reviews.text: Junk , it broke on the first use , I'm so disappointed,
customer_reviews.author: Amaquietlywhisperszon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works great. I made a screw for my drill by ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it with my drill cut 100 ears less than 40 min. , works great . I made a screw for my drill by cutting the head off a good size lag screw. Try it !!
customer_reviews.author: TLS

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality, Breaks quickly
customer_reviews.text: This item broke after the 5th use. Very poorly put together. Would never buy another product from this company.
customer_reviews.author: wyonole

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The corn cutter did not last an hour of cutting, one blade broke.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Came apart at the rivets.
customer_reviews.text: Used it for 7 dozen ears one day, 2 ears on a 2nd day and broke on the 87th ear that I did (3rd day I used it).
customer_reviews.author: AngelaBusch

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Item broke in half after only 4 cobs of corn. Junk!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Hintz

customer_reviews.title: broken
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2. They both broke the first time I used them
customer_reviews.author: charles e snedaker

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Would buy this again. Makes the job so much easier
customer_reviews.author: Jim Whitmore

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Biggest piece of junk. It made it through 3 ears of corn before the blade broke off. Sending it back for a refund. What a piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Dad

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We used this on over 1000 ears of corn. My 10 year old daughter did about 300 by herself. It made creaming the corn to put in the freezer so much easier. We were fighting over it so we ended up buying 2 more. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Natasha Russ-Long

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: This “corn cutter” does not work. Wish I could return it, but I’m just outside my 30 return period.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Adams

customer_reviews.title: Its very hard to use
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to use & not very well made. It leaves alot of the base corn on the cob.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: can't wait to use it
customer_reviews.text: this is going to make removing corn off the cob so much easier, I can't wait to use it soon.
customer_reviews.author: froghollow

customer_reviews.title: Blade broke off handle
customer_reviews.text: I only used it on 24 ears of cooked corn. One side of the blade came off. It looks like the rivet may not have been put on well but either way it should have held up. Didnt even have it 24 hours. Otherwise It was pretty easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: This lasted through 10 ears of corn. The aluminum rivets broke on ear 11. I waited too long to return it so I'm out the $. But please heed this warning. It will break. It is a waste of money and Amazon needs to remove it from their website.
customer_reviews.author: Jolene P

customer_reviews.title: Harder than I imagined
customer_reviews.text: I was soo excited to use this and when corn was 10 cents an ear a few weeks ago I got 12 ears. I used this and after I found the knife was still much easier.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ball

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Blades are too thin and flimsy. Curvature isn't tight enough. May be okay for cream corn but you leave half of each kernal on the ear. Squeezing the handles tighter just flattens out the blades making them useless
customer_reviews.author: Mark Fields

customer_reviews.title: Ok in a supporting role only
customer_reviews.text: Used this as a secondary tool to do the final scrape of the corn cob for more juice. I liked this tool for that use. Probably would not enjoy using this to strip the whole corn cob
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: The easiest I have ever cut sweet corn. I used a bunt pan and the cutter. No more knives for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: BROKE ON FIRST USE - not work a single cent!
customer_reviews.text: My fiancée had one of these things in the family. They used it for decades. THIS ONE BROKE ON THE FIRST USE! DON’T BOTHER. Seriously. Not even worth the measly $5.99, let alone a cent. Past my return window. At least that’s all the money I lost.
customer_reviews.author: Rugger-Biker

customer_reviews.title: Nice Little Tool
customer_reviews.text: Worked great to strip corn from the cob to freeze. Easy to use and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Linda S.

customer_reviews.title: Peeling
customer_reviews.text: I only used this a few times and the coating is peeling off. Chunk of yellow paint in yellow corn. I am glad I saw it pop off and was able to remove it.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Loved it
customer_reviews.text: I used the kernel kutter along with the drill bit for the cob. They are awesome together, they saved us a lot of time and made the most difficult part of processing corn easy and enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Hub

customer_reviews.title: Best kitchen tool ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best kitchen tool I’ve purchased! It is so easy to use and it is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Florida-Girl

customer_reviews.title: Works Very Well
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. I will probably order 2 or 3 more just to have them on-hand for next year so that I can "can" all of my fresh corn instead of taking up valuable freezer space with whole ears. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Catatonic

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Works great, slices the kernels off the cob fairly easily with a little practice. We use it by standing the cob up on a plate, and pushing the Kutter down over the cob. This method doesn't quite get the last row of kernels off the cob, so have to flip it over and re-Kut (or just chew the last row directly off the cob).
customer_reviews.author: Dan Smith

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This broke the first time that we used it. Don't waste your time or money.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel McMillion

customer_reviews.title: But have used it before and loved the design to get lots of corn off cob
customer_reviews.text: Didn't get enough corn to put up this year. But have used it before and loved the design to get lots of corn off cob. To stabilize it we used a 4 inch nail stuck through a piece of wood or old cutting board. Then laid the board in a quarter cake pan which collected all the corn as it was sliced off the the cob. Pull the cob off the nail and repeat.
customer_reviews.author: LMc

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good tool.
customer_reviews.text: It works pretty good. It didn't get all the stuff so I used a knife after and still saved time over only using a knife. I think it would have worked perfect if I had bigger ears of corn.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: doesn't work good if you're old and can't push it down over ...
customer_reviews.text: doesn't work good if you're old and can't push it down over the corn not worth it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Failed after second use
customer_reviews.text: Metal got bend after the second use.. Definitely do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: T. Bohm

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I just didn’t use it right but it didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Progress!
customer_reviews.text: Wow this is slick! Put up 1200 ears lickity split! Be sure to order the bit it's a no go without it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: seemed to be sturdy. haven't used yet
customer_reviews.text: bought for my sister-in-law. seemed to be sturdy. haven't used yet.
customer_reviews.author: hawkmom

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for us
customer_reviews.text: Maybe others had better luck with theirs, but all this managed to do was squish the corn.
customer_reviews.author: Dick Day

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This held up through 50 doz. ears of corn. Well made.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: Just ok - doesn't get all of the corn so you still have to use a knife.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: 5+ stars
customer_reviews.text: This makes cutting corn off the cob a breeze! Very easy to use, just follow the instructions that are included.
customer_reviews.author: ANF

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and much faster than with a knife
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this corn cob kernel stripper at the end of the season last year. I never used it until today a little more than a year later. The blade broke in half after the 3rd corn cob. I followed the instructions as directed. The rivet that holds the blade is obviously not strong enough. Also the device seems to be better suited for slender rather than plumper cobs of corn. Very disappointing. Look elsewhere for a kernel stripper.
customer_reviews.author: R. OHara

customer_reviews.title: There was another piece that was supposed to go with ...
customer_reviews.text: There was another piece that was supposed to go with it, if you wanted to cut the corn raw..it wasn't offerd on site or mention'd in description. ..or i would have gotten it...or not if not offered!
customer_reviews.author: Tom S

customer_reviews.title: Strange little gadget...
customer_reviews.text: It arrived timely and we have not the foggiest idea what to do with it...did we order this product under the haze of too many Makers Mark juleps on a balmy, Big Greasy afternoon? Who knows...but if we ever figure it out, "y'all" will be the first to know.
customer_reviews.author: LA-Lawyer

product_meta.title: HIC Quick Corn Cutter Stripper, Stainless Steel Blade, 10-Inches
product_meta.description: Style Name:Corn CutterHIC’s Quick Corn Cutter easily cuts kernels from ears of corn to enjoy sweet corn without the cob. Now it’s easy to enjoy fresh sweet corn without the cob, and quickly make those favorite corn recipes, like creamed corn, corn pudding, fritters, and more. A helpful addition to canning supplies, the Corn Cutter also helps prepare fresh corn in just minutes for canning and freezing corn for year-round enjoyment. The sharp blades are specially curved to wrap around and hug the cob while removing every delicious kernel with a single downward motion. They easily expand open to accommodate larger ears of corn. The non-slip grips offer a safe and secure grasp, even if hands get wet. Made with stainless steel blades, HIC’s Quick Corn Cutter is sturdy, durable, and dishwasher safe for easy cleanup.
feature_bullets: HIC’s Quick Corn Cutter easily cuts kernels from ears of corn to enjoy sweet corn without the cob, freeze or can corn, and make delicious corn recipes
Made with stainless steel blades; non-slip grip for a secure grasp, even when hands are wet; sturdy and durable
Sharp curved blades wrap around the cob and remove every delicious kernel in a single downward motion; blades easily expand to fit larger ears of corn
Easily enjoy fresh sweet corn without the cob, freeze corn for later use, and make corn recipes, like creamed corn, corn pudding, fritters, and more

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars203 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
